descriptions: Does not identify any changes in the home, school, or community that promote safety.
Identifies one change in either the home, school, or community, but lacks support for its safety benefits.
Identifies changes in two of the three environments (home, school, or community) with limited support for their safety benefits.
Identifies changes in all three environments (home, school, and community), but the support for their safety benefits is superficial or incomplete.
Clearly identifies changes in all three environments (home, school, and community) and provides solid support for how these changes promote safety.
Identifies changes in all three environments and insightfully supports with detailed evidence, reasoning and analysis how these changes significantly improve safety.
Provides no reasoning or justification for how the identified changes promote safety.
Offers minimal or irrelevant reasoning for how the identified changes promote safety.
Offers some reasoning for how changes promote safety, but reasoning is unclear or not fully developed.
Provides adequate reasoning and justification for how the identified changes promote safety in the home, school and community.
Provides well-reasoned and logical justification for how the identified changes promote safety, showing a clear understanding of cause and effect.
Provides exceptional, insightful and thoroughly detailed reasoning, with well-articulated evidence, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding of the impact of the proposed changes on safety.
